title: Quiz 1 - Statement of Course of Action
instruction: Directions: In each question below is given a statement followed by two courses of action numbered I and II. A course of action is a step or administrative decision to be taken for improvement, follow-up, or further action I regard to the problem, policy etc. on the basis of the information given in the statement. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true then decide which of the two given suggested courses of action logically follows for pursuing. Give answer.

quiz.text: Statement: The film industry has been on the downslide because of the invasion of unauthorised videos.Course of action: I. Persons making unauthorised videos should be sentenced to life imprisonment.II. The film industry should make commercially lucrative films.III. The government should waive entertainment tax levied upon films
options: Only I follow
I and II follow
II and III follows
I and III follow
None follow

quiz.text: Statement: The demand for automobiles has slumped indicating a possible recession in the automobile sector.Course of action: I. The government should announce tax reliefs to the automobile sector.II. The automobile sector should reduce the prices of the products.III. The industrialists should look for some better business ventures than automobiles.
options: I and II follow
II and III follows
I and III follow
Only I follow
Only II follows

quiz.text: Statement: Some bottles of cold drinks have been found to contain dead insects, flies and even lizards. Course of action: I. People should be told about these incidents. II. Cold drink manufacturers should be punished and imprisoned for selling hazardous products. III. The sale of cold drinks should be banned.
options: Only I follow
I and II follow
Only II follows
II and III follow
Only III follows

quiz.text: Statement: An official of the sports committee has been accused of corruption and favouritism.Course of action: I. The committee should sack the official immediately. II. The committee should dismiss the allegation as mischievous talk.III. The committee should suspend the official for the time being.
options: None follows
Only III follows
Either I or III follows
Either II or III follows
Any one of I, II or III follows

quiz.text: Statement: It has now been proved that most of the cases of leprosy are not infectious and that they are curable.Course of action: I. An awareness drive should be launched among people regarding this fact.II. People should be encouraged not to boycott leprosy patients from the society.III. Leprosy should be declared a risk-free disease by the government.
options: Only I follows
I and II follow
I and III follow
II and III follow
All follow

quiz.text: Statement: Despite the provision of legal punishments, the system of dowry remains prevalent in our society. Course of action: I. Focus should be diverted to proper execution of the legal provisions. II. Stricter laws should be enforced by the Parliament against dowry. III. The youth should be persuaded to rebel against their parents and indulge in no dowry marrieages.
options: Only I follows
I and II follow
II and III follow
All follow
I and III follow

quiz.text: Statement: Some newspapers have alleged that some of our eminent sportsmen offered bribe to their adversary team to ensure victory.Course of action: I. The concerned sportsmen should be suspended from all active participation in sports.II. The concerned sportsmen should file a defamation suit against the newspapers.III. Proper enquiry should be done regarding the matter.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
I and III follow
Only III follows
Either I or II and III follow

quiz.text: Statement: It is feared that the food which the delegates have just consumed could be poisonous. Course of action: I. The delegates should be given treatment for food-poisoning. II. The delegates should be rushed to a hospital. III. Medical help should immediately be sought.
options: II  and III follow
Only III follows
Only I follows
I or III follows
I and III follows

quiz.text: Statement: Indian press is sceptic about the government’s plans to open Indian newsmarket to international competition. It is feared that Western press will pump biased opinion into Indian mind.Course of action: I. Indian Press should be convinced that its apprehensions are baseless.II. Western press should not be allowed to come to India.III. The government should set up a censor board for Western press.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
Only III follows
II and III follow
I and III follow

quiz.text: Statement: Despite its various measures, the SEBI has not had much success in controlling the stock market. The brokers continue to flaunt rules making use of the loopholes therein. Course of action: I. The SEBI should be wound up. II. The rules should be reviewed so that there are no loopholes in them. III. The SEBI should be given more powers so that it could deal sternly with the erring brokers.
options: I and II follow
II and III follow
I and III follow
All of them follow
Only III follows

quiz.text: Statement: An IAS officer has been killed in Bihar by irate mobs. It is being suspected that the police played a deliberately inert role during the incident. Course of action: I. All IAS officers in Bihar should be given tight security. II. The police officials concerned should be suspended. III. The Chief Minister of Bihar should resign on moral grounds.
options: I and II follow
Only II follows
Only I follows
I and III follow
All follow

quiz.text: Statement: The new wave of the parallel cinema has become a sick industry. Plagued by lack of funds and willing talent, it has lost its appeal, which is an unfortunate development.Course of action: I. The government should provide financial aid to parallel cinema.II. The parallel cinema should change itself to have commercial appeal.III. People should be persuaded to watch parallel cinema.
options: Only I follows
I and II follow
Only II follows
II and III follow
I and either II or III follow

quiz.text: Statement: The salaries of private sector employees has nearly doubled in the past two years.Course of action: I. Higher income tax rate should be imposed on private sector imployees.II. The wages of public employees should also be doubled.III. A further rise should not be allowed.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
Either I or II follows
None follows
At least one of the above follows

quiz.text: Statement: The police has failed to protect the elderly citizens of the society. Only last week three old persons were killed at three different places. Course of action: I. The police should be asked to take special care of women and children. II. The government should bring a legislation against the killing of elderly people. III. Criminals who are accused of killing elderly people should be prosecuted by the state.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
Only III follows
III and II follow
None follows

quiz.text: Statement: Inflation is rising again.Course of action: I. Efforts should be made to find out the cause of this.II. Fiscal deficit should be controlled.III. Special efforts should be made towards drip-irrigation technology.
options: Only I follows
I and II follow
Only II follows
None follows
All follow

quiz.text: Statement: India has been facing the problem of child labour despite several legislations.Course of action: I. India should treat child labour as a trivial issue.II. Child labour should be declared civil offence.III. Children indulging in such activities should be punished.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
Only III follows
Either II or III follows
None of the above.

quiz.text: Statement: After the success of film such as Hum Aapke Hain Kaun and Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jaynege good music and clean entertainment are back again. Course of action: I. Movies having good music and clean entertainment should be promoted. II. The two movies mentioned above should be awarded for their clean entertainment. III. The government should ban movies that are not like these two films.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
I and II follow
I and III follow
II and III follw

quiz.text: Statement: Although launched with great fanfare, private mutual funds have performed badly.Course of action: I. Private mutual funds should be banned.II. Operations of mutual funds should be controlled by the government.III. Mutual funds should be given the government’s protection.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
Only III follow
II and III follow
None follow

quiz.text: Statement: The economic scenario of the country is improving rapidly. But some states like Bihar seem to be going from bad to worse. Course of action: I. President rule should be imposed in Bihar. II. Heavy privatisation should be pursued in such states. III. The governments of such states should be asked to re-evaluate their economic planning.
options: Only II follows
Only III follows
II and III follow
I and III follows
Either II or III follows

quiz.text: Statement: Some politicians have expressed apprehension over the government’s proposal not to allow a wage hike for the loss-making PSUs. They think that this not justified. Course of action: I. The government should abandon its proposal. II. The government should ignore the apprehension of these politicians and enact its proposals. III. The government should consult the employees of the loss-making PSUs and listen to their point of view.
options: Either I or II follow
II and III follows
I and III follow
Only III follows
III and either I or follow

quiz.text: Statement: Footpaths of a busy road are crowded with vendors selling cheap items.Courses of action: I. The help of police should be sought to drive them away.II. Some space should be provided to them where they can earn their bread with blocking footpaths.
options: If only I follow
If only II follows
If either I or II follows
if neither I nor II follows
If both I and II follow

quiz.text: Statement: Since its launching in 1981, Vayudoot has so far accumulated losses amounting to Rs. 153 crore during the last ten years.Courses of action: I. Vayudoot should be directed to reduce wasteful expenditure and to increase passenger fare.II. An amount of about Rs 300 crore should be provided to Vayudoot to make the airline economically viable.
options: If only I follow
If only II follows
If either I or II follows
if neither I nor II follows
If both I and II follow

quiz.text: Statement: the Indian electronic component industry venturing into the West European markets faces tough competition from the Japanese.Courses of action: I. India should search for other international markets for its products.II. India should improve the quality of the electronic components to compete with the Japanese in capturing these markets.
options: If only I follow
If only II follows
If either I or II follows
if neither I nor II follows
If both I and II follow

quiz.text: Statement: Youngest are often found staring at obscene posters.Courses of action: I. Children should be punished and penalised if they are found doing so.II. Any display of such materials should be banned.
options: If only I follow
If only II follows
If either I or II follows
if neither I nor II follows
If both I and II follow

quiz.text: Statement: A train was derailed near a station while moving over a bridge and fell into the river.Courses of action: I. The Railway authorities should clarify the reason of the accident to the Government.II. The Government should allocate funds to compensate for the destruction caused.
options: If only I follow
If only II follows
If either I or II follow
if neither I nor II follow
If both I and II follow
